content.description: The figure shows equipotential lines in a particular region. The value of the potential along each line is indicated. Two points, <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, lie along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis. The electric field at Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is <math alttext="vector E sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math> and the electric field at Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> is <math alttext="vector E sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>. Which of the following correctly compares the magnitudes of <math alttext="vector E sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math> and <math alttext="vector E sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>, and indicates whether the vectors are in the same or opposite direction?
content.question: MagnitudesDirectionsA<math alttext="E sub A is less than E sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>Same directionB<math alttext="E sub A is less than E sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>Opposite directionsC<math alttext="E sub A is greater than E sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>Same directionD<math alttext="E sub A is greater than E sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>Opposite directions

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
